I cancelled my PayPal account a couple of years ago, after reading a horror story in a german computer magazine. In this article I learned that the PayPal balance can go negative. The person in that article fell victim to an eBay fraud, which resultet in a negative PayPal balance for him. PayPal didn't listen to his repeated explanations, but instead sent dept collectors after him.

Bisq (formerly known as bitsquare). It is decentralized. Less 3rd party risk, no registration, no KYC. 
Second favorite is Kraken. They have had solid HW based 2FA for a long time, and so far always worked well.

Yeah, I also once had a friend become an addict. I let him sleep in my appartment when they threw him out of his place. While I was in the shower, he stole $400 that I had in my purse. Half a year later I had the police at the door with a warrant. He gave them my address when asked where he lived. So they went through the stuff he left with silicone gloves. My wive (then girlfriend) was freaked even more then myself.
He was a good guy once, but that's what drugs can do. Some time later my mother showed me a newspaper where it was reported that his body was found dead.

@Styromaniac: The tragic thing about my former friend is the reason he became an addict. He couldn't handle how his wive became schizophrenic. His mother in law blamed him, and the psychiatrist told him so search another wife if he ever wanted to have kids.
@Styromaniac: That is a personality trait. But I think many addicts, at least where I live, ended up this way because they resigned at something that happened to them in their lives.
Did you ever watch a video with a presentation by Elon Musk? I bet he mutters more and it isn't a problem for him.

My current BQ Aquaris Ubuntu Edition slowly starts to desintegrate.

@Styromaniac: It's a fine balance between freedom and privacy on one side, and not wanting to deal with all the bad stuff on the other. And it's a hard problem to solve. I think I can deal with it for myself, but I'm still not sure how I want to educate my kids on these matters. On one hand I don't want to send them to the centralized, curated, surveiled platforms. On the other hand, I don't want them to discover horrible stuff on a free and open platform. With time you learn how to avoid this stuff, but to get there you have to understand the hints.

Frankly, I don't know. Since December, my phone never ran for more than five minutes when I used it, or half an hour without using before it constantly froze. I always hoped that this would be fixed with a software update. Thus every week I booted it and installed the upgrades. Then about a month ago after an upgrade it got stuck in the boot process. It has been the same ever since. Their support suggested that I should reflash the phone, but not even that works any more.

@Ansho Rei: From what I read in the forums, it seems that I am the only one this unfortunate with the L5. I really hope they can turn it into a good working product. I also have a Librem13 and this one works really well.
@Ansho Rei: I switched back to my BQ 4.5 UE for now. The battery live is not great, but it is enough for me. I would also try the PinePhone, but they only accept PayPal.
There are OpenSource alternatives to every proprietary program. Sanctions are more harmful in many other areas.
I love OpenBazaar, and always look there before ebay and such. But how is it going to continue after OB1 ran out of funding?
Yeah, its PayPal only. Otherwise I would have bought a PinePhone and a PineBook  long time ago. They promised to accept Bitcoin for a while, but nobody knows when that will happen.
@Styromaniac: I guess that works differently in each country. In Switzerland it is a reasonable tax and an insane handling fee that you have to pay separately upon receipt.

@Styromaniac: My Librem5 completely stopped working last summer. After I got a replacement, I switched back to the L5 as my primary phone in September. It works more or less, but it is still not where it should be. My boss ordered a PinePhone Mobian edition for me and I payed him in BTC. That should arrive by the end of February.
@Styromaniac: Before I sent back the faulty L5, I also flashed it like in the video.
What device is this?
@Styromaniac: I'm not really int gaming, at least for the last 25 years. What is so good about it? Is it all open source?

That would be cool indeed. That would be a console for the TV right? My last game console was a Nintendo NES. Now that we have a giant screen in our new home I wondered how cool that would be for gaming. Only to find out that PS5 are sold out for months, and used PS4 cost more than I thought. For the last decade I only considered OpenSource games on OpenSource platforms. So a linux based console would be less removed from that than a regular one.
